lcInstruction.p: In addition to PDF output, this lesson also shows you how to generate HTML output using the DITA Open Toolkit. The exercise for generating HTML output will use the same content as the PDF exercise. Seeing the same content in two different output types will give you a firsthand look at the way DITA separates content from formatting.
The following instructions show you how to publish HTML output from the DITA OT:

task.title: Generating HTML output on a PC

step.cmd: Type the following commands into your command window:
Press ENTER to run the DITA Open Toolkit.

step.info: In addition to the PDF files you generated earlier, you should now see multiple HTML files and an images folder.

step.cmd: Open the file index.html in a browser.

info.p: This index file serves as an electronic table of contents, showing the hierarchy of your map with links to each topic file. The DITA OT's default xhtml plugin does not provide navigation, but the index file can help you find the topics you need.

step.cmd: Open the file c_duckling_growth.html in a browser to see how the default XHTML plugin displays images and tables.
